availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Obediah Dickerson McManama (Grant County, KY, prosecuting attorney)

body.p: Williamstown, Kentucky, attorney. Boone County, Kentucky, native. Son of James McManama and Mary Pollie McManama. Graduated from the University of Louisville law school in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1853. Married to Mariam Tulley McManama in 1855. Father of Mary Ella McManama, Stella McManama, Victor McManama, and Nora McManama. Prosecuting attorney from 1854 to 1862. Attorney in Williamstown in 1860. Arrested in Grant County, Kentucky, for Confederate sympathies on July 14, 1862. Imprisoned at Camp Chase, Ohio, until November 5, 1862.

ab.bibl:
